abstract: Microsoft’s $1.2 billion bid for a Norwegian search software company is seen as an effort to add tools to its lucrative Office products and fend off Google.
snippet: Microsoft’s $1.2 billion bid for a Norwegian search software company is seen as an effort to add tools to its lucrative Office products and fend off Google.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft bid $1.2 billion on Tuesday for a Norwegian search software company, in what analysts said was mainly an effort to add more tools to its lucrative Office products, but was also being done with an eye toward fending off Google.

headline.main: Microsoft Bids for Search Software Firm
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Bids for Search Software Firm

abstract: Microsoft‘s $1.2 billion bid on Tuesday for a Norwegian search software company, was seen mainly as an effort to add more tools to its lucrative Office products, but was also being done, analysts said, with an eye toward fending off Google.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft‘s $1.2 billion bid on Tuesday for a Norwegian search software company, was seen mainly as an effort to add more tools to its lucrative Office products, but was also being done, analysts said, with an eye toward fending off Google.

headline.main: With Fast Search Deal, Microsoft Aims at Google
